com.lasarobotics.library.sensor.modernrobotics

Class OpticalDistance

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lasarobotics.library.sensor.modernrobotics.OpticalDistance

  • public class OpticalDistance
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the Core Optical OpticalDistance Sensor with advanced methods This sensor is only fully accurate UP TO 5 CM Different lighting conditions greatly affect distance read after 5 cm away from the object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OpticalDistance(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.OpticalDistanceSensor sensor) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getDistance()
      Gets an approximate distance from the object in centimeters Formula based on empirical measurements in 2700K lighting at room temperature with a white semi-reflective object perpendicular to the beam Please note that these values are only SOMEWHAT ACCURATE between 0.5 and 5 cm!
      double getLightDetected()
      Gets the raw light reflected as a decimal
      java.lang.Boolean objectClose()
      Returns true if an object is close enough to get an accurate distance measurement of +- 1 cm, assuming light object
      java.lang.Boolean objectDetected()
      Returns true if an object is detected within the sensor's absolute maximum range (25 cm)
      java.lang.Boolean objectNear()
      Returns true if an object is near the sensor (within 5-10 cm)
      void update(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.OpticalDistanceSensor sensor) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance()
        Gets an approximate distance from the object in centimeters Formula based on empirical measurements in 2700K lighting at room temperature with a white semi-reflective object perpendicular to the beam Please note that these values are only SOMEWHAT ACCURATE between 0.5 and 5 cm!
        Returns:
        An approximate distance in centimeters
